intro: Euthamia caroliniana, commonly known as white goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features upright, branching stems that bear clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows between 2 to 4 feet tall and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. White goldenrod is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
